III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iii)Threats of restraint, seclusion, punishment, or otherwise
suggesting physical or emotional harm to a youth.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff 1 told Youth A and Youth S she would beat their asses if
they were her kids. Staff 1 cocked her hand back as if she would
strike Youth B.
Investigation Interviews
I notified Youth A’s and Youth S’ Foster Care Workers of the
investigation assignment. They expressed no additional licensing
concerns. I asked Youth S’ Foster Care Worker not to discuss the
allegations with Youth S, but she had already discussed them.
I interviewed Complainant/Rights Officer via phone on 2/23/24.
He had no additional information or concerns.
I interviewed Youth A with Rights Officer present. She has been
at the facility for six months. Youth A said Staff 1 called her a
“coward” and “said if I wanted to fight her, we could go in my room
and close the door.” Youth A said Staff 1 was not serious about
fighting her and she is not afraid of Staff 1 because, “We play like
that.” Afterward Youth A said Staff 1 apologized if she offended
her.
I interviewed Youth S with Rights Officer present. She has been
at the facility for two weeks. Youth S said “Staff 1 threatened me,
said we were on her ‘hit’ list and called us cowards. Youth S said
she feels disliked by Staff 1 but does not feel scared. “She called
me a ‘pussy,’ said ‘I’d beat your ass if you were my kid’ then
cocked her hand back and gave me a hug.”
I interviewed Staff 1 via Teams with Rights Officer present. She
has worked midnight shift at Vista Maria for seven months and
has limited contact with the youths unless she picks up overtime
2

on dayshift. Asked if Staff 1 called Youth A a coward, she
clarified, “I never called her a coward. I told her that jumping
someone is a coward move. Youth A agreed I was right...I never
threatened to take her in her room and jump her.”
I asked Staff 1 if she and Youth A play and tease each other.
Staff 1 affirmed that they play, color and talk. “Youth A will say if I
don’t give her a hug, she’ll throw water or take my backpack,” and
laughed. “She tries to get me to interact with her.” I asked why
Youth A threatening to throw water was funny. Staff 1 responded,
“It’s funny because I know Youth A won’t do it. That’s the bond
we have.”
I asked about how she relates with Youth S, Staff 1 said “I don’t
know her (Youth S) to play or joke like that, but I do (know) the
other girls” and denied telling either girl they were on her “hit” list.
Staff 1 stated “I told her it was a coward move. She asked me if I
had kids and what I would do if they jumped someone. I told her
I’d whip my kids. I suggested she pray, and she thanked me. We
hugged…” Staff 1 denied cocking her hand back or calling Youth
S a “pussy” because “I don’t know her well enough to play with her
like that.” When Staff 1 heard Youth A and Youth S were
offended by the interactions, she said it was a “wake-up call” and
she felt hurt. Staff 1 said apologized to each of them separately
“because that was not my intent.”
Documents reviewed:
There were no incident reports written regarding the verbal
interactions with Staff 1 as described by Youth A and Youth S.
Analysis Staff 1 is a newer staff who works midnight shift and has very little
direct contact with the youths. There is no evidence she
threatened physical harm or spoke in a derogatory manner to the
youths. However, she did respond to a hypothetical question
posed by the youth that was taken out of context. Staff 1 did
admit she feels comfortable teasing and joking around with certain
youths she has developed a rapport with.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
I advised Staff 1 against teasing, engaging in verbal “play”,
sharing personal information with, and responding to hypothetical
situations presented by youth. I asked her to review her staff
training materials related to setting and maintaining professional
boundaries.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
3

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
